intro: Epidendrum gravidum, commonly known as the heavy-bearing epidendron, is a species of orchid native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is characterized by its long, pendant inflorescences that bear numerous showy, fragrant flowers in shades of white, yellow, and orange. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees and utilizing aerial roots to absorb moisture and nutrients from the air.
